H0.text: Acidic is the condition of the land near some rivers that results from deposition of sediment during floods.

H1.text: Fertile is the land near some rivers that results from deposition of sediment during floods.

H2.text: Hilly is the result of deposition of sediment during floods making the land near some rivers.

H3.text: Unstable is what deposition of sediment during floods makes the land near some rivers.

A4.text: a region with little relief (local changes in elevation) yet with a constant but slight slope.

A5.text: Because of regular flooding, floodplains frequently have high soil fertility since nutrients are deposited with the flood waters.

A6.text: Floodplains support diverse and productive ecosystems.
